definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: When you borrowed the money to buy your home, you signed a promissory note – an IOU.
sentences.chinese: 當你借來的錢去買你的家，你籤本票安借據。

sentences.english: Pre-payment with cashier's check or money order is accepted.
sentences.chinese: 預付款用本票或匯票都可以。

sentences.english: The summoned should report to the court with his summons.
sentences.chinese: 本票由被傳喚人攜帶來院報到。

sentences.english: Pre-payment with cashier's check or money order is accepted
sentences.chinese: 預付款用本票或匯票都可以。

sentences.english: The promissory note is a document in which A promises to pay a sum of money to B.
sentences.chinese: 本票是規定甲方向乙方支付一筆款額的一種文據。
明天是一張還未到期的本票。

sentences.english: Then I need a cashier's check made out to the IRS.
sentences.chinese: 此外，我需要一張開給國稅局的銀行本票。

sentences.english: All remittances must be made by cheque or banker's cashier order in Hong Kong dollars.
sentences.chinese: 所有股款必須以港元之支票或銀行本票支付。

sentences.english: He payed his subscription by banker's order.
sentences.chinese: 他用銀行本票支付購股金。

sentences.english: What if I lose the bank draft?
sentences.chinese: 如果我遺失了銀行本票怎麼辦？

definition: to present (a bill of exchange etc) for payment
to accept (i.e. acknowledge as calling for payment) (commerce)/to honor (a check, a promise)
remittance/funds paid to a bank account
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
